channel.title: Nooby linux questions
channel.description:
I'm planning to install ubuntu without removing windows. I just have a couple of questions before I do it.
1. Is it really necessary to back up all my data before installing?
2. If I suddenly decide that I don't want ubuntu anymore, can I safely remove it without effecting windows? I was reading about GNU/GRUB and I'm the impression that if I suddenly formatted my ubuntu partition, my computer won't boot anymore.
Thank you!

item.title: Nooby linux questions
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

I already tried it using the live cd, and even though its supposed to be slower, I was still impressed by its performance. Thanks for the help guys, I successful installed it and its running fine!

Read full topic

item.title: Nooby linux questions
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If you just want to try it out, you can install it while running windows with wubi, the performance hit is negligible and if you decide you don’t like it you just have to delete a file. (just put in the CD, or mount it with daemon tools or the like and install it just like a program)

Read full topic

item.title: Nooby linux questions
item.dc:creator: @parabolika parabolika
item.description:
@parabolika wrote:

If you value your data, I would not advise skipping the backup step. Especially on your first installation.

Read full topic

item.title: Nooby linux questions
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:2, topic:293540”]1) not really

  1. yes, what you do is insert the windows cd, go to recovery console, and type in fixmbr.

Then boot into windows and delete the ubuntu partition[/quote]

Thanks alot.

Read full topic

item.title: Nooby linux questions
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

  1. not really

  2. yes, what you do is insert the windows cd, go to recovery console, and type in fixmbr.

Then boot into windows and delete the ubuntu partition

Read full topic
